text:
Using linestyles is currently broken on CairoMakie because it interprets the dash-gap-patterns as multiples of linewidth.

I am happy to fix this in a PR. I just need to know if you want (W)GLMakie to interpret lengths as multiples of linewidth, or if CairoMakie should use a fixed scaling factor instead of linewidth. (I guess <@UK1BNFHFV> is the go-to person when it comes to aesthetics ;-))

see <https://github.com/JuliaPlots/Makie.jl/issues/807#issue-781251725>

text: looking good :) I think in GLMakie linestyles are not so great anyway, because of the implementation in fragments if I understand correctly. Basically in CairoMakie the whole line is drawn from beginning to end, while in GLMakie each fragment has its own triangles, so you get uneven dashes. Correct me if I'm wrong Simon but that's how I always explained to myself that dashes look like this in GLMakie
